title: Supreme Court Denies Request to Revisit Same-Sex Marriage Decision
summary: Kim Davis, a Kentucky county clerk who refused to issue same-sex marriage licenses, had asked the court to reconsider its landmark 2015 opinion.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Major Challenge to Mail-In Ballot Laws
summary: The justices agreed to hear a challenge to Mississippi’s law, a case that could upend similar measures in dozens of states before the 2026 election.

title: Prison Guards Shaved His Dreadlocks. The Supreme Court Will Decide if He Can Sue.
summary: Lower courts condemned the treatment of Damon Landor, a Rastafarian, but found that a federal law protecting religious rights barred him from suing prison officials for money.

title: Which Senators Broke Ranks With Democrats to Advance the GOP Plan to End the Government Shutdown?
summary: Two of them are retiring, and none of the others face re-election in 2026.

title: Six Takeaways From the Senate Deal to End the Shutdown
summary: For 40 days, Senator Chuck Schumer kept his caucus unified. But an end approached without an extension of expiring health insurance subsidies that Democrats had demanded.

title: Jeanne Shaheen Faces Shutdown Blowback From Her Daughter
summary: Senator Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire voted to move to end the shutdown. But her daughter Stefany Shaheen, a congressional candidate in their state, sharply criticized the deal.

title: Trump Pardons Rudy Giuliani and Others Involved in Effort to Overturn 2020 Election
summary: The pardons of former Trump aides, which would only apply in federal court, are largely symbolic and cannot shield them from continuing state-level prosecutions.

title: U.S. Military Kills 6 in Strikes on Suspected Drug Boats, Hegseth Says
summary: The latest strikes raised the death toll in the campaign to 76 people in 19 attacks in the Pacific and the Caribbean Sea since early September.

title: Trump Tries to Seize ‘Affordability’ as Americans’ Economic Worries Grow
summary: The issue has buoyed Democrats and is resonating with an American electorate that is souring on the president’s economic agenda.

title: F.B.I. Director Is Said to Have Made a Pledge to Head of MI5, Then Broken It
summary: The episode has contributed to concerns among intelligence allies that Kash Patel, brash and partisan, is also unpredictable and even unreliable.

title: Unwed Mothers and Their Children Are Trapped in Saudi Arabia
summary: A Times investigation found that children are routinely deprived of birth certificates, medical care and education. Diplomats and police officers turned the mothers away.

title: Why Children of Unmarried Mothers Are Stranded in Saudi Arabia
summary: We pieced together the details, from Riyadh to Nairobi.

title: A MAGA Senator Promised Hope for a Dying Ohio Mill. Then Reality Set In.
summary: The town’s unionized workers wanted to believe that there was something better than what private equity owners had offered.

title: At COP30 in Belém, Brazil, Chinese Technology Is Shifting Climate Politics
summary: At this year’s climate summit, the United States is out and Europe is struggling. But emerging countries are embracing renewable energy thanks to a glut of cheap equipment.

title: Why Everyone Wants to Meet the ‘World’s Most Boring Man’
summary: Politicians, oil giants and climate activists hang on his every word. The Trump administration has blasted him. How did Fatih Birol get so big?

title: R.F.K. Allies Embrace ‘Anti-Vax’ Label They Once Rejected
summary: A weekend gathering in Texas drew activists, homeopaths, doctors, lawyers, parents and a Republican senator who asked, “Why isn’t Tony Fauci in prison?”

title: F.D.A. Will Remove Black Box Warnings From Hormone Treatments for Menopause
summary: The benefits of hormone replacement have been underappreciated, Dr. Marty Makary, the agency’s commissioner, said on Monday. Critics described evidence for the change as insufficient.

title: Syria al-Shara al-Baghdadi Trump
summary: In 2019, President Trump sent U.S. commandos to a small village in Syria to kill the leader of the Islamic State. On Monday, Syria’s president, a former associate of that leader, will take another step to strengthen his alliance with the White House.

title: Syria’s President to Meet Trump at White House for First Time
summary: The visit by President Ahmed al-Shara is another step in the transformation of the former rebel leader once wanted by the United States as a terrorist.

title: The Many Faces of Syria’s President, Ahmed al-Shara
summary: Ahmed al-Shara has shifted shapes many times during his ascent from rebel commander to national leader. This week, he is expected to be the first Syrian president to address the U.N. General Assembly in 58 years.

title: BBC Director Tim Davie and CEO Deborah Turness Quit Following Trump Documentary Turmoil
summary: The abrupt moves followed furor over claims that a documentary had misleadingly edited footage of President Trump’s speech before the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

title: Trump Threatens to Sue the BBC for $1 Billion After Jan. 6 Documentary
summary: A lawyer for the president said the BBC’s editing of a speech Mr. Trump gave on Jan. 6 was “defamatory.” The broadcaster on Monday apologized for an “error in judgment.”

title: What to Know About the BBC Resignations and Turmoil Over a Trump Speech Edit
summary: Two top executives quit after a memo by a former adviser said that the broadcaster had misleadingly edited a speech by President Trump.

title: Mamdani Fills 2 Top Posts With Government Veteran and Trusted Aide
summary: The mayor-elect named Dean Fuleihan, a government veteran, to be his first deputy mayor. Elle Bisgaard-Church will serve as his chief of staff.

title: Why Debt Funding Is Ratcheting Up the Risks of the A.I. Boom
summary: While the tech giants have plenty of money to build data centers, smaller outfits are taking on debt and taking big chances to work with them.

title: As the Russia War Continues, Ukraine Faces a Major Draft Evasion Problem
summary: Ukraine faces a major draft-evasion problem, but no place is quite like Vylkove, a Danube River town where men of draft age have all but vanished, many of them trying to avoid military service.

title: Ukraine’s Anti-Corruption Agencies Push Back Despite Zelensky Pressure
summary: Months after Ukraine’s president tried to cripple them, the agencies said they had uncovered a major scheme involving the state-owned nuclear energy company.

title: The Post-Cold War Era Is Over. What Should We Call This New One?
summary: We have arrived at a “Polycene” moment where binary systems are giving way to multiple interconnected ones.

title: What Were Democrats Thinking?
summary: This is how the shutdown ends?

title: Democrats Defect on the Shutdown
summary: Congress moved closer to ending the government shutdown. We explain what’s happening.

title: Recently Ousted Director of Philadelphia Art Museum Sues Over Her Dismissal
summary: Sasha Suda claims the museum did not have a valid reason for abruptly firing her last week from one of the most prominent jobs in the art world.

title: Nicolas Sarkozy, Former French President, Is Released From Prison Pending Appeal
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy served about three weeks of a five-year prison sentence for his conviction in a campaign finance scandal.

title: Bernie Sanders Endorses Peggy Flanagan for Senate in Minnesota
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders is backing Lt. Gov. Peggy Flanagan in her state’s Democratic primary race for Senate, his latest attempt to pull the party to the left.

title: Explosion Reported Near Red Fort in New Delhi
summary: India’s top security official said the cause of the blast, near the Red Fort in the capital, was still being investigated.
